instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.CHGR_CELL: What is CHGR_CELL? CHGR_CELL is a signal going to the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 battery charging chip that sets PPBUS_G3H voltage. Macbook Airs with 2 cells in series  in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 8.15v to 8.55v, Macbooks & Macbook Pros with 3 cells in series in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 12.23 to 12.56v..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi I’ve got this board 1.7 volts
Isl 6259
<SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL>= 16.36v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL>= 3.98v
Pins 28, 29 =20.4Ohm
Pins 17, 18= 3ohms
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = .2ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and green light on Magsafe?
Did you check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Any history available, liquid sign?

Post other <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 9, 15, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes diode mode to ground on f9700 .459v
Yes <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> =3.42v
Din Green light on MagSafe
No signs of water damage
I will check voyages on pins you suggested and get back to you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Pin 1=0v
Pin12= 3.43v <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
Pin13 = 3.42v 
Pin 14 =3.32v <SIGNAL>SMC_BC</SIGNAL> _acok
Pin 15=0-1.49v fluctuates
Pin 19=5v
Pin 20=5v
Pin 27=16.31v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"Pin 15=0-1.49v fluctuates "
Should stay under 0.5V...
You forgot pin 9.

Check again resistance between pins 17/18, directly on the chip.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 1.7 v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Pin 9=0v

I’m sorry

nothing with smc bypass model
I resoldered all the pins go <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
and now I have a solid green light and 4v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
I have <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> at pin 1 3.42v of <RESISTOR>R7940</RESISTOR> And pin 12 of <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> is 736ohms It say 1k (<SIGNAL>CHGR_CELL</SIGNAL>) I have 3.42v at <SIGNAL>CHGR_CELL</SIGNAL> And 3.42v at pin 12 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> so I checked for continuity between pins 12 and 6 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> There’s continuity.
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> I have 6.8v on pin 1 but 0v at pin 2
(<SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE_DIV</SIGNAL>) Going to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> “<RESISTOR>R7806</RESISTOR>” measures
Can <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> be shorting <SIGNAL>CHRG_ACIN</SIGNAL> to ground?

Still 0v on pin 1 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Oddly when I plug in charger the fan bumps a lil. Bit just like a 1/8” twice each time I plug it in to MagSafe 
Lastly should I check for signal both pins 11 and 10 Smc data lines with oscilloscope  ?

threads.message:

These give me issues :( out of 10- <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> Only 2 where good. eBay is getting progressively worse

threads.message:
The board works now, after changing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
Pin 1/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> MUST stay at 0V.
